thread.title: GM Tops Ford in a Low-Growth Environment

title: GM Tops Ford in a Low-Growth Environment
text:
GM Tops Ford in a Low-Growth Environment Lear and Delphi Automotive are two preferred supplier stocks with catalysts and strong management teams. Aug. 19, 2015 11:47 a.m. ET 
Credit Suisse 
In a global production environment that we expect to be low-growth and highly competitive over the next few years, we prefer the auto company that is showing an ability to grow earnings despite flattish volumes. 
We prefer General Motors (ticker: GM) over Ford Motor (F). GMâ€™s $1.2 billion of self-help material/logistics savings was a 170 basis points total company margin tailwind in the first half and fixed... Get The Full Story
